page.title: 05Wetwang,Harvest on the Farm
page.content: Harvest on the farm is one of the most busy times for the farmer and everything has to be right to get a good crop. Everything depends on the weather and if it is a long wet summer like this one in 1985 then the harvest goes on and on. The corn has to be ripe and dry before it can be combined but once this has been done then the corn goes into the corn cart and is taken to the drier.It goes through a number of stages there.First it goes into the pit and then through a hole in the bottom of the pit and up a pipe to a machine that sorts out the grain from all the rubbish.The rubbish goes into sacks which are thrown away when full and the grain goes up another pipe into a big bin where it is stored.
